questions.guidance_text: Enter your company's full legal name as registered with the Registrar of Companies. This should match your incorporation certificate and GST registration. The insurance policy will be issued in this name.

Enter your 15-character GST identification number. This unique number helps verify your business registration and determines applicable tax rates on the insurance premium. Format: First 2 digits represent state code.
Provide your company's 10-character Permanent Account Number issued by the Income Tax Department. This is required for tax documentation and claim settlements exceeding certain limits.

Select the category that best describes your primary business activity. This helps insurers understand the operational environment of your boilers and pressure vessels, as different industries have varying risk levels and safety requirements.
Enter the year your company was established or incorporated. Older, established companies often have better safety records and maintenance practices, which can positively influence premium rates.

Enter your company's total annual revenue in rupees for the last financial year. This helps insurers assess your business size and determine appropriate coverage limits. Use the figure from your latest audited financial statements.

Provide the complete address where all policy documents and correspondence should be sent. Include building name, street, area, city, state, and PIN code. This may be your registered office or corporate headquarters.
questions.placeholder: e.g., 5th Floor, ABC Tower, Industrial Area, Phase-2, Pune, Maharashtra - 411018

questions.guidance_text: Enter the exact address where your boilers and pressure vessels are installed and operating. This is the location that will be insured and inspected. If different from communication address, provide complete details including nearest landmark.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Plot No. 45, MIDC Industrial Estate, Taloja, Navi Mumbai, Maharashtra - 410208

questions.guidance_text: Indicate if you have boilers/pressure vessels at multiple locations that need coverage. Multiple location policies can be structured as a single floater policy or separate policies for each location based on your preference.

List all additional locations with complete addresses where boilers/pressure vessels are installed. Include the number and type of equipment at each location. This helps in accurate risk assessment and premium calculation.
questions.placeholder:
e.g., Location 2: Plot 78, GIDC Vapi, Gujarat - 2 Boilers
Location 3: Industrial Park, Chennai - 1 Boiler, 3 Pressure Vessels

questions.guidance_text: Mention the nearest railway station to your risk location. This helps insurers and surveyors plan inspections and assists in emergency response planning. Include approximate distance from your facility.

Select the coverage duration you need. Annual policies are standard, but long-term policies (2-3 years) often come with premium discounts and protect against rate increases. Multi-year policies also reduce administrative burden.

Choose when you want the insurance coverage to begin. If replacing existing coverage, ensure this date immediately follows your current policy expiry to avoid coverage gaps. Coverage starts at 00:00 hours on the selected date.

Enter the total number of boilers you want to insure. Include all steam boilers, hot water boilers, and thermal fluid heaters at your facility. Each boiler will need detailed specifications for accurate premium calculation.

Enter the total number of pressure vessels requiring coverage. This includes air receivers, autoclaves, digesters, reactors, and storage vessels operating under pressure. Vessels with different pressure ratings may have different premium rates.

Provide detailed specifications for each boiler and pressure vessel including make, model, year of manufacture, capacity, working pressure, and current replacement value. This information is crucial for risk assessment and determining sum insured.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Boiler 1: Make-Thermax, Model-Shellmax, Year-2018, Capacity-10 TPH, Pressure-21 kg/cm2, Value-â‚¹75,00,000

questions.guidance_text: Enter the total current replacement value of all boilers and pressure vessels to be insured. This should reflect the cost to replace the equipment with new items of similar capacity, not depreciated or book value. Underinsuring can lead to proportionate claim settlements.

Confirm if your boilers are registered under the Indian Boilers Act, 1923. Registration is mandatory for most boilers and indicates compliance with safety standards. Insurance is typically not available for unregistered boilers.

Indian Boiler Regulation (IBR) certification confirms your equipment meets national safety standards. Valid certificates are essential for insurance coverage and indicate regular statutory inspections are being conducted.

Enter the date of the most recent statutory inspection by the Boiler Inspector. Regular inspections (usually annual) are mandatory and help identify potential issues before they become serious problems. Recent inspection reports may be required.

Indicate how often safety valves on your boilers and pressure vessels are tested. Regular testing ensures these critical safety devices will function when needed. More frequent testing demonstrates better safety practices and may result in lower premiums.

Standard boiler insurance covers damage to the boiler itself from explosion. Select 'Yes' if you also want coverage for damage to surrounding property and third-party liability arising from boiler explosion. This significantly enhances your protection.

Business interruption coverage compensates for lost profits if boiler breakdown stops your operations. This covers continuing expenses and lost income during repairs. Essential for businesses where boilers are critical to production.

questions.question_text: Indemnity Period for Loss of Profit (months)
questions.guidance_text: Select the maximum period for which you want business interruption coverage. This should reflect the time needed to repair/replace equipment and resume normal operations. Longer periods provide better protection but increase premium.
If you currently have or previously had boiler insurance, mention the insurance company name. Continuous coverage history and claim-free years may qualify you for better rates and no-claim bonuses.

Indicate your boiler-related insurance claims in the past 5 years. This includes claims for boiler damage, explosion, or business interruption. Your claims history significantly impacts premium rates and coverage terms.

Provide details of past claims including date, nature of damage, cause, amount claimed, and corrective actions taken. This helps insurers assess whether previous issues have been adequately addressed.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Date: 15/03/2023, Cause: Tube failure due to scaling, Amount: â‚¹5,00,000, Action: Implemented water treatment system

questions.guidance_text: Upload a copy of your current IBR certificate or latest inspection report. This document validates the safety compliance of your equipment. Accepted formats: PDF, JPG, PNG (max 5MB).

Upload a detailed list of all boilers and pressure vessels with their technical specifications, if available in a separate document. This helps expedite the quotation process. Excel or PDF format preferred.

Mention any special circumstances, additional coverage needs, or specific concerns about your boiler operations. Include information about planned upgrades, unique operating conditions, or specific exclusions you want to avoid.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Planning to add 2 new boilers in Q3 2025, need provision for mid-term inclusion
